title: Rescued roadside kitten is family's saving grace
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper showcases heartwarming moments from viewers, including a surprise birthday party for a 99-year-old nun and a roadside kitten rescue. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

title: Eyewitnesses say Nigerian forces opened fire on protesters in Lagos
description: Clashes between protesters and law enforcement agents in Lagos turned bloody on Tuesday, despite a state-wide curfew, with eyewitnesses telling CNN that multiple demonstrators have been shot by soldiers.

title: Trump abruptly ends '60 Minutes' interview before taping joint appearance with Pence
description: President Donald Trump abruptly ended a solo interview with CBS News' "60 Minutes" Tuesday and did not return for an appearance he was supposed to tape with Vice President Mike Pence, according to multiple sources familiar with what happened.

title: After years of shrugging off the President's scandals, Senate Republicans are trying to distance themselves from him, fearing he may lose in two weeks
description: For four years, Republican senators have shrugged off President Donald Trump's constant string of controversies and scandals. They've ignored his Twitter outbursts and endless grievances. And they've avoided confronting him, while voting mostly in lockstep for his agenda and protecting him during his impeachment trial.

title: Marcus Rashford gives PSG deja vu with another late winner in Paris
description: Paris Saint-Germain was left experiencing some unwanted Champions League deja vu, as Marcus Rashford struck a late winner to give Manchester United all three points in the opening match of the group stages Tuesday.

title: Woman dies on a plane of Covid-19
description: A Dallas-area woman died due to Covid-19 while on a flight in Arizona, a Dallas County official said.

title: Tapper: Officials stunned by White House push for this 5G deal
description: CNN's Jake Tapper reports that senior officials are concerned about White House pressure on the Pentagon to lease premium real estate for the lucrative 5G market to Rivada, a company that has prominent GOP investors, in a deal that could be worth tens of billions. Rivada is denying they want a noncompetitive deal.

title: Coffee smells like burnt tires: See how Covid-19 changed their sense of smell
description: From coffee that smells like burning tires, to garlic that smells like garbage, a growing number of people who contracted Covid-19 are reporting foul smells and tastes after getting sick.

title: He oversaw the bin Laden raid. See what he says about Trump
description: Retired Navy Adm. William McRaven, the former head of US Special Operations Command who oversaw the successful raid that killed Osama bin Laden, said he is voting for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.

title: Fearing a loss, GOP senators keep distance from Trump
Earthquake interrupts Iceland Prime Minister's interview
description: Iceland's Prime Minister was interrupted by an earthquake while filming an interview on Tuesday -- but managed to shrug off the intrusion and finish her answer.

title: Keilar: Host has history of peddling baseless claims
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar looks back at Fox Business host Maria Bartiromo's history of pushing false claims and analyzes Bartiromo's interview style with President Trump.

title: Bletchley Park codebreakers' contribution to WWII overstated, new book claims
description: The contribution of famed codebreaking facility Bletchley Park to the Allied victory in World War II has been overstated, according to the author of an official history of British intelligence agency GCHQ.

title: Melania Trump cancels plans to attend Tuesday rally, citing Covid-19 recovery
description: Melania Trump is canceling her first campaign appearance in months because she is not feeling well as she continues to recover from Covid-19.

title: Trump called CNN 'bastards' for covering Covid-19. Hear Keilar's response
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar responds to President Trump's comments at a rally that people are "tired of the pandemic" and those who continue to cover the crisis are "dumb bastards."

title: Danish submarine murderer Peter Madsen caught after escaping prison
description: Police have captured Peter Madsen, the Danish inventor found guilty of the mutilation and murder of Swedish journalist Kim Wall, after he briefly escaped from a jail near Denmark's capital.

title: Why a Democratic landslide could crush the GOP for the next decade (or more)
description: With independent political handicappers revising upwards the likelihood of Joe Biden winning the presidency and Democratic gains in the Senate and House in recent days, there is now a reasonable chance that we may be looking at a major landslide up and down the ballot in two weeks' time.

title: This car just smashed through speed records at 316 mph
description: A little-known American automaker has just snatched the title of world's fastest production car.

title: Watch this production car break world speed record
description: SSC North America announced that its Tuatara model has reached an average speed at 316.11 miles per hour during two record-breaking dashes outside Las Vegas.

title: The search for Fungie: Ireland's beloved bottlenose dolphin is missing after 37 years
description: As the Irish government moves the country back into a strict, national lockdown for six weeks, an unlikely story continues to break through the endless Covid-19 headlines.

title: Analysis: New debate rules will make it hard for Trump to be Trump
description: On Monday night, the Commission on Presidential Debates unanimously approved a new rule for Thursday night's final debate that will make it virtually impossible for Donald Trump to be, well, Donald Trump.

title: James Redford, filmmaker and son of Robert Redford, dies at 58
description: James Redford, an activist, filmmaker and philanthropist, has died, a rep for his father, actor and director Robert Redford, confirmed to CNN Tuesday.

title: Premier League facing backlash over $19 pay per view charge
description: The Premier League is facing a wave of criticism for charging fans £14.95 ($19.39) to watch games via pay per view (PPV).

title: John Roberts put the country before politics
description: In the most important pre-election case this year, Chief Justice John Roberts once again appears to have decided that, for the Supreme Court, discretion is the better part of valor.

title: Trump administration to sue Google, claiming it abused its dominance in search
description: The Trump administration will sue Google on Tuesday in what is the largest antitrust case against a tech company in more than two decades.

title: Satellite images indicate Russia is preparing to resume testing its nuclear-powered cruise missile
Beazley Designs of the Year nominees unveiled
description: The coronavirus illustration, TikTok's infamous "Renegade" dance and a water filtration system supported by Jaden Smith have all been nominated as some of the year's most game-changing designs.

title: Analysis: Trump is fuming over Fauci's credibility
description: Facts First Hub | Road to 270 | Report voting issues

title: The world's longest flight is back -- and it'll be longer
description: Singapore Airlines' Newark to Singapore route is the longest passenger flight in the world. Now it's coming back after being paused by the pandemic, and will fly to JFK

title: Ryder Cup and Solheim Cup to be played in 'two-week festival of golf' in 2023
description: The 2023 Ryder Cup and the Solheim Cup will be played in back-to-back weeks in what has been billed a "two-week festival of golf."

title: More Hispanic workers impacted by Covid-19 in food processing and agriculture workplaces, CDC study finds
Analysis: The Trump reset will never come no matter how much he needs it
description: Around the time the President fell ill with Covid-19, his friends called in to try and buck him up -- and offer some friendly nudging.

title: What's next for no-touch air travel?
description: How many times do you touch the cabin around you in an airplane when you fly? How about the airport? How many times do the people working there touch your belongings?

title: Airline that went bust due to Covid makes a comeback
description: It was one of the early casualties of the Covid-19 pandemic. Now, it looks set to be resurrected.

title: 35 years after his murder, a victim is identified -- because of his belt buckle
description: More than 35 years after his body was discovered, a murder victim in Florida was successfully identified by police because of a belt buckle his family member recognized.

title: Locust swarms spread across Ethiopia aided by heavy rains and Covid pandemic
description: Widow-of-ten Marima Wadisha screamed, threw rocks and in her desperation even fired bullets at the locusts that descended on her sorghum fields in northeast Ethiopia.

title: Rush Limbaugh says his lung cancer is terminal
description: Rush Limbaugh, the conservative talk show radio host, is battling stage 4 lung cancer and said Monday he's had a setback in his prognosis.

title: Australia Covid-19 test blunder prompts calls for hundreds to take HIV test
description: More than 200 former residents of coronavirus quarantine facilities in Australia are being urged to test for blood-transmitted diseases, including HIV, after authorities admitted they used the same blood-testing devices for multiple guests.

title: Canadian town of Asbestos chooses new name
description: It's been one of the most divisive elections in North America this year.

title: Patrick Mahomes breaks NFL touchdown pass record as the Kansas City Chiefs bounce back to win
description: And just like that Patrick Mahomes broke a NFL touchdown pass record as the Kansas City Chiefs got back to winning ways against the Buffalo Bills.

title: A rainforest campus, stunning theaters and a museum fit for a pharaoh: Africa's most anticipated architecture
description: Great architecture captures the world's attention -- if it's good enough, a single building can put a city on the map. These buildings are symbols of ambition as much as they are of beauty, and when leveraged correctly, they're a worthy investment, attracting people and opportunities.

title: Struggling to work productively from home? Let strangers watch you
description: Some days Diana Calvo Martínez works at the laboratory, moving from microscope to test tube, studying microbes. Other days she's analyzing graphs from her living room, or has her head down writing her thesis from the kitchen table. Occasionally, she's washing the dishes or cleaning the floor.

title: Australia to join India, US, Japan in large naval exercises
description: Australia will join India, the United States and Japan in next month's Malabar naval exercises in the Indian Ocean, in a move that is expected to strengthen the military relationship between the four democracies amid increased tensions with China.

title: Town renames sewage plant after late-night comedian
description: The John Oliver Memorial Sewer Plant is now a reality. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on a feud that didn't go to waste.
